midi
Class Instrument

java.lang.Object
  midi.Instrument
Direct Known Subclasses:
Piano
public class Instrument
extends java.lang.Object

Represents an instrument which can play notes.

Constructor Summary
Instrument(int patch)
          Constructs an instrument from a patch number.
 
Method Summary
 void playNote(Note n, int duration)
          Make the instrument play a Note for the specified duration, and at the default (full) velocity (volume).
 void playNote(Note n, int duration, int velocity)
          Make the instrument play a Note for the specified duration, and at a specific velocity (volume).
 void rest(int duration)
          Make the instrument rest for the specified duration.

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Instrument

public Instrument(int patch)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
Constructs an instrument from a patch number.

Parameters:
patch - the patch to use
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if patch is outside of the range of available patches
javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - if MIDI playback is unavailable
Method Detail

playNote

public void playNote(Note n,
                     int duration)
Make the instrument play a Note for the specified duration, and at the default (full) velocity (volume). This method is a convenience method for playNote(n, duration, 127).

Parameters:
n - the Note to play
duration - the duration to play the Note (in milliseconds)
See Also:
playNote(Note, int, int)

playNote

public void playNote(Note n,
                     int duration,
                     int velocity)
Make the instrument play a Note for the specified duration, and at a specific velocity (volume).

Parameters:
n - the Note to play
duration - the duration to play the Note (in milliseconds)
velocity - the velocity (volume) to play the Note

rest

public void rest(int duration)
Make the instrument rest for the specified duration.

Parameters:
duration - the duration to rest (in milliseconds)
